revised_title: Observations on a New Comet by William Herschel
tldr: In 1787, William Herschel shared his observations of a newly discovered comet with the Royal Society. He used a 10-foot reflector telescope to study the comet's position and appearance, comparing it to the third nebula of the Connoissance des Temps. He noted the comet's brightness, its central nucleus, and its diffused coma and faint, scattered light in the north following part.
